titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Michael Erlewine classicposters.com collection.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

physdesc.extent: 1 hard drive (225 GB, 426,781 files), 327 CDs, and 22 DVDs (in 4 boxes)

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: Michael Erlewine is an enterpreneur, collector, and musician from Big Rapids, Michigan. He founded the All Music Guide and Matrix Astrology, and performed with the Prime Movers blues band. He was also active in founding the Ann Arbor Blues Festival. He is also an active Buddhist and philantropist, and founded and runs the Heart Centers for Meditation and Communion Studies.
archdesc.scopecontent: Digital images of Michael Erlewine's collection of rock and roll posters. The collection includes raw, cropped, and thumbnail versions of the images created in Erlewine's digitization process, and a Filemaker Pro 9 database, wchich contains the cropped versions of the digitized images and associated descriptive information. The collection significantly features the work of the following artists: Gary Grimshaw, Kerry Awn (Kerry Fitzgerald), Frank Kozik, Randy Tuten, Mark Arminski, Jermaine Rogers, Rick Griffin, and Rainbow Graphics. The collection also includes digital audiorecordings of Erlewine's interviews with several rock-and-roll poster artists.

did.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

physdesc.extent: 1 hard drive (225 GB, 426,781 files), 327 CDs, and 22 DVDs (in 4 boxes)

The collection significantly features the work of the following artists: Gary Grimshaw, Kerry Awn (Kerry Fitzgerald), Frank Kozik, Randy Tuten, Mark Arminski, Jermaine Rogers, Rick Griffin, and Rainbow Graphics. The collection also includes digital audiorecordings of Erlewine's interviews with several rock-and-roll poster artists.

c01.scopecontent: Digital audio recordings of Michael Erlewine's interviews with various rock-and-roll poster artists. Among those interviewed are Gary Grimshaw, Stanley "Mouse" Miller, Art Chantry, Randy Tuten, and Frank Kozik.
